thread.title: The story of Syracuse football at midseason in 109 seconds (video)
thread.title_full: The story of Syracuse football at midseason in 109 seconds (video)

author: Brent Axe | baxe@syracuse.com
title: The story of Syracuse football at midseason in 109 seconds (video)
text:
Comments 
The Syracuse University football team is set to enter the second half of the 2015 season on Saturday when it faces Pittsburgh at the Carrier Dome (noon, ESPNU). 
The first half of the season brought us a lot to talk about, including a potential quarterback of the future, a team that relies on freshman for nearly 70 percent of its offense, a defense that needs to tighten up the fundamentals and two "winnable" games against South Florida and Virginia that slipped out of SU's hands. 
It all adds up to 3-3 with an uphill battle to bowl eligibility ahead with three ranked teams dotting the schedule in the final six games. 
Before we move on to second half of the season, check out the video above for a quick video review of Syracuse's first half.

Listen to "On the Block" with Brent Axe weekdays from 5-6 p.m. on ESPN Radio Syracuse
